title: Introduction to Soft Circuits
description: In this class, we will go over conductive materials used in creating soft circuits, such as different thread, fabrics, inks and fasteners, along with looking at microcontrollers designed specifically for wearable electronics. Projects that have been created utilizing these techniques will also be shown. We will then create a simple soft circuit with a switch and that lights up a LED. Attendees will have the chance to learn or expand on basic hand sewing techniques and experience working with new materials and skills.

title: Wearables Hack Day
description: Do you sew? Do you play with microcontrollers? Then join us for ITP Camp wearables hack day!
comment: I’d like to participate, but I’ll be also going to 2 sessions during this period.

title: Smart Dust – is it inevitable?
description: I’d argue that the era of the commodity beige box is coming to an end, and the days of the general purpose computer are almost over. Most people never needed or wanted a computer, and they’re going to be happy with more limited devices optimised for a single, or a few, purposes so long as those devices just work. Today the black rectangle has replaced the beige box, but don’t get too comfortable, because it won’t last as long. Today’s cellphones and tablets are transition devices, dependent on our current level of technological progress, and around you everyday objects are already becoming smarter.

title: Don’t Go Back to School–independent learning for everybody
description: Forget education reform, let’s transform learning itself! I’m excited to share the research that went into my recently published handbook on independent learning called Don’t Go Back to School, based on interviews with 100 independent learners. Let’s talk about how independent learning works, and how to get more people doing it and taking it seriously, and how it fits into the future of education, daily life, and the world we want to live in. My next contribution to the cause will be a set of guidelines for learning oriented working groups. I’d love to hear your approaches.

title: Intro to Python
description: This workshop will serve as an introduction to the Python programming language.  Topics covered will include:

title: Intro to Scratch (and Makey Makey)
description: Scratch is a free program geared towards teaching kids introductory programming skills through gamemaking and animation. It can be paired easily with the Makey Makey, an extremely easy-to-use microcontroller that can turn anything into a keyboard. Come check it out!

title: Guest Speaker: Clive Thompson – “the new literacies”
comment: It would be awesome if this started 30 minutes later so that it didn’t overlap Dan’s Rest of You workshop. #itpcampproblems

title: Wearable and Mobile Accessories
description: Kate Hartman and Shawn Van Every will give a tour through some of the recent wireless and wearable platforms and products that are emerging and give a workshop on how we might prototype some ideas of our own.

title: Creating a Killer Finish
description: We have two great tools in the shop for applying a fantastic finish to wooden and metal projects.

title: End-of-Camp Shindig
description: Half show & tell, half party, the End of Camp Shindig is an opportunity to celebrate the month we’ve spent together and share what we’ve created.
